title: Introduction to Scratch Programming
summary: Learn the basics of Scratch programming language and how to create your first interactive project with drag-and-drop blocks.
author: Educational Team

title: Creative Computing with Scratch
summary: Explore how Scratch can be used to develop computational thinking skills and create engaging multimedia projects.
author: Dr. Sarah Johnson

title: Scratch in the Classroom: Best Practices
summary: Discover effective strategies for integrating Scratch programming into K-12 curriculum and engaging students in coding.
author: Prof. Michael Chen

title: From Blocks to Code: Transitioning from Scratch
summary: Learn how to help students transition from visual programming in Scratch to text-based programming languages.
author: Lisa Rodriguez

title: [2002] Rethinking Learning in Digital Age
summary: This foundational paper examines how digital technologies can transform learning experiences and educational paradigms. Resnick explores the potential of digital tools to support constructionist learning and creative expression.
author: Mitchel Resnick

title: [2005] Extending Tangible Interfaces for Education: Digital Montessori-inspired Manipulatives
summary: This paper explores the design and implementation of tangible interfaces for educational purposes, drawing inspiration from Montessori educational methods. The research investigates how physical manipulation can enhance digital learning experiences.
author: Mitchel Resnick
url: ../papers/[2005-MR] Extending Tangible Interfaces for Education Digital Montessori inspired Manipulatives.pdf

title: [2009] Scratch: Programming for All
summary: This seminal paper introduces Scratch as a programming language designed for everyone, particularly children and beginners. It outlines the design principles, educational goals, and community aspects that make Scratch accessible to diverse learners.
author: Mitchel Resnick

title: [2010] The Scratch Programming Language
summary: A comprehensive technical overview of the Scratch programming language, covering its design philosophy, implementation details, and educational applications. This paper serves as a definitive reference for understanding Scratch's architecture and capabilities.
author: Mitchel Resnick

title: [2012] New Frameworks for Studying and Assessing the Development of Computational Thinking
summary: This influential paper presents new approaches to understanding and evaluating computational thinking development in educational contexts. It provides frameworks for researchers and educators to assess how students develop computational thinking skills.
author: Mitchel Resnick
